intro: Lepidagathis secunda, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive silver-green foliage and daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its compact growth habit and ornamental value make it a popular choice for horticultural use. Lepidagathis secunda is also noted for its ability to tolerate drought conditions once established.
